headline.main: Beyond the Chokehold: The Path to Eric Garner’s Death

byline.original: By AL BAKER, J. DAVID GOODMAN and BENJAMIN MUELLER
byline.contributor: Nate Schweber and Benjamin Weiser contributed reporting, and Elisa Cho and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

docs.abstract: Interviews and previously undisclosed documents provide deeper perspective on how seemingly routine police encounter led to 2014 choking death of Eric Garner; tensions between police and Garner had been building long before fatal confrontation; omission from initial police report that officer had used choke-hold, as well as fact that emergency medical workers withheld potentially life-saving oxygen, may have influenced grand jury; detailed timeline of events surrounding Garner's death given.
docs.lead_paragraph: After the fatal confrontation with the police on Staten Island was captured on video, the focus on an officer’s chokehold left many questions unexplored.
docs.snippet: After the fatal confrontation with the police on Staten Island was captured on video, the focus on an officer’s chokehold left many questions unexplored.

headline.main: Michelle Obama Guest-Edits Issue of More Magazine

docs.lead_paragraph: The first lady is the first guest editor for the lifestyle publication aimed at women. The issue will be available on newsstands on June 23.
docs.snippet: The first lady is the first guest editor for the lifestyle publication aimed at women. The issue will be available on newsstands on June 23.

headline.main: Warning: Soda May Be Bad for Your Health, San Francisco Says

docs.abstract: San Francisco could soon be the first city in the country to place health warnings on advertisements for sugary drinks.
docs.snippet: San Francisco could soon be the first city in the country to place health warnings on advertisements for sugary drinks.

headline.print_headline: San Francisco Moves to Put Warnings on Ads for Sugary Drinks
headline.main: San Francisco Moves to Put Warnings on Ads for Sugary Drinks

docs.lead_paragraph: Soda and some other sugary drinks contribute to health problems, San Francisco supervisors said as they voted unanimously to approve health warnings on ads for such beverages.
docs.snippet: Soda and some other sugary drinks contribute to health problems, San Francisco supervisors said as they voted unanimously to approve health warnings on ads for such beverages.

headline.print_headline: California: Labels on Ads for Sugary Soda Advance
headline.main: California: Labels on Ads for Sugary Soda Advance

docs.abstract: San Francisco Board of Supervisors unanimously approves requirement within city limits that print advertising for sugary sodas and other drinks carry warnings about potential risks related to obesity, diabetes and other health problems; measure will be first in country if it receives second round of approval from supervisors and is not vetoed by mayor.
docs.lead_paragraph: San Francisco supervisors voted unanimously Tuesday to approve health warnings on ads for sugary sodas and some other drinks.
docs.snippet: San Francisco supervisors voted unanimously Tuesday to approve health warnings on ads for sugary sodas and some other drinks.

headline.print_headline: A Former Top Spokesman for the Obama White House Heads to the Golden Arches
headline.main: McDonald’s Hires Robert Gibbs, Ex-Press Secretary for Obama

docs.abstract: Robert Gibbs, former press secretary to Pres Obama, will join McDonald's as global chief communications officer.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Gibbs, who left the White House in 2011, will join McDonald’s as global chief communications officer.
docs.snippet: Mr. Gibbs, who left the White House in 2011, will join McDonald’s as global chief communications officer.

headline.print_headline: San Francisco Approves Health Warning on Sugary Drink Ads
headline.main: San Francisco Approves Health Warning on Sugary Drink Ads

docs.lead_paragraph: San Francisco supervisors voted unanimously Tuesday to approve health warnings on ads for sugary sodas and some other drinks, saying such beverages contribute to obesity, diabetes and other health problems.
docs.snippet: San Francisco supervisors voted unanimously Tuesday to approve health warnings on ads for sugary sodas and some other drinks, saying such beverages contribute to obesity, diabetes and other health problems.

headline.print_headline: Global Diabetes Rates Are Rising as Obesity Spreads
headline.main: Global Diabetes Rates Are Rising as Obesity Spreads

docs.abstract: Study published in British medical journal The Lancet reports sharp rise in global rate of Type 2 diabetes, which is related to obesity and has historically been prevalent in wealthy countries; study highlights major shift in deaths in developing world, away from communicable diseases and toward chronic illnesses like cancer and diabetes.
docs.lead_paragraph: The prevalence of diabetes has been rising in rich countries for several decades, largely driven by increases in the rate of obesity. More recently, poorer countries have begun to follow the trend.
docs.snippet: The prevalence of diabetes has been rising in rich countries for several decades, largely driven by increases in the rate of obesity. More recently, poorer countries have begun to follow the trend.
